intro: Oxybaphus nyctagineus var. cervantesii, commonly known as the Mexican nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, and it produces small, violet-colored flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, yellowish seeds. This species is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
